title: Shyam buys 10 apples for Rs 1. At what price should he sell a dozen apples if he wishes to make a profit of 25%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cost Price of 10 apples = Rs 1 Cost Price of 1 apple = Rs 1/10 i.e Rs 0.1 So, Cost Price of 12 apples (a dozen) = 12 *0.1 = Rs 1.2 Let the SP be Rs X Profit = (SP of 12 apples-CP of 12 apples) Profit = (X-1.2) Profit ℅ ={ Profit /CP of 12 apples}*100 =>25= {(X-1.2)/1.2}*100 => (25*1.2)/100 = X -1.2 =>0.3 =X-1.2 X =1.5 So the Selling price should be Rs 1.5 to make a profit of 25℅

Cost Price of 10 apples = 1 Rs. Cost Price of 1 apple = 1/10 Rs. or 0.10 Rs. As Shyam wishes to make a profit of 25%, His selling price per apple will be = C.P of 1 apple + Profit = 0.10 + 25% of 0.10 = 0.10 + (25/100) × 0.10 = 0.125 Rs. If the selling price of 1 apple is 0.125 Rs , Then Selling price of 12 apples = 12 × 0.125 = 1.5 Rs
